headline.main: Ad Watch: Ad Tries to Link Ex-Worker's Losses to Bain

docs.abstract: Priorities USA Action, a "super PAC" supporting President Obama, released an advertisement on Tuesday suggesting that Mitt Romney's actions indirectly contributed to a woman's death.
docs.snippet: Priorities USA Action, a "super PAC" supporting President Obama, released an advertisement on Tuesday suggesting that Mitt Romney's actions indirectly contributed to a woman's death.

headline.main: The Affordable Care Act Rebate Checks Are in the Mail: Now What?

docs.abstract: Small-business owners are receiving millions of dollars in rebates thanks to the health care overhaul. What these owners can do with the money is not entirely clear.
docs.snippet: Small-business owners are receiving millions of dollars in rebates thanks to the health care overhaul. What these owners can do with the money is not entirely clear.

docs.lead_paragraph: In an election focused on the economy, the votes from the legions of unmarried women who helped lift President Obama to victory in 2008 are now up for grabs.

headline.seo: In Weak Economy, an Opening to Court Votes of Single Women
headline.main: In Weak Economy, an Opening to Court Votes of Single Women
headline.print_headline: In Weak Economy, an Opening to Court Votes of Single Women

docs.abstract: Legions of unmarried women, worried over the economy, are increasingly undecided on who they will vote for in the upcoming election, despite having voted primarily Democratic in years past; Pres Obama's and Mitt Romney's presidential campaigns are lavishing attention on single women voters, who are becoming one of the country's fastest-growing demographic groups.
docs.snippet: In an election focused on the economy, the votes from the legions of unmarried women who helped lift President Obama to victory in 2008 are now up for grabs.

byline.contributor: Robert Gebeloff contributed reporting from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: Research scholars at the Hastings Center discuss the need for health insurance for undocumented immigrants.
docs.snippet: Research scholars at the Hastings Center discuss the need for health insurance for undocumented immigrants.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that offering paid sick leave might reduce the rate of nonfatal injury among workers and improve the bottom line at the same time.Using data on about 38,000 workers from a national survey conducted by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, researchers found that from 2005 to 2008 the injury rate per 100 workers among those with paid sick leave was 2.59, compared with 4.18 among those without.

headline.main: Vital Signs | Safety: Paid Sick Leave May Reduce Work Injuries

docs.abstract: Abay Asfaw study in The American Journal of Public Health suggests that paid sick leave might reduce the rate of nonfatal injury among workers while simultaneously improving profits. (M)
docs.snippet: A new study suggests that offering paid sick leave might reduce the rate of nonfatal injury among workers and improve the bottom line at the same time.Using data on about 38,000 workers from a national survey conducted by the Centers for Disease...

headline.main: Monday Reading: August Checklist for Rising High School Seniors

docs.abstract: You might divide the American political debate into those who think the poor and middle class get too many government benefits and those who think the rich do.

docs.lead_paragraph: The campaign against Senator Claire McCaskill of Missouri, fueled by tax-exempt groups backing Republican candidates, may be a precursor to such efforts on a broader scale.

headline.seo: In Missouri Senate Race, Ads Beset Incumbent Democrat
headline.main: Outside Cash in Missouri Race Could Be a National Model
headline.print_headline: Outside Cash in Missouri Race Could Act as National Model

docs.abstract: Sustained campaign attack against Democratic incumbent Sen Claire McCaskill in MIssouri, fueled by tax-exempt groups backing Republican candidates, could become a textbook for future efforts in a new era of anything-goes campaign financing; money has flowed in largely to take down the Democrat, providing vital air cover while the Republicans fight each other below the radar; three Republican candidates may be lesser known and less dynamic than McCaskill, but she is possibly the most endangered incumbent in the Senate.
docs.snippet: The campaign against Senator Claire McCaskill of Missouri, fueled by tax-exempt groups backing Republican candidates, may be a precursor to such efforts on a broader scale.

docs.lead_paragraph: Massachusetts will be the first state to try to cap overall health care spending, both private and public, so that it will grow no faster than the state economy.
docs.abstract: Editorial applauds Massachusetts for passing a bill that will try to cap overall health care spending, the first such bill in the nation; questions whether the plan is bold enough to succeed; contends that regardless of the result, the plan will offer valuable lessons to the rest of the country.
docs.snippet: Massachusetts will be the first state to try to cap overall health care spending, both private and public, so that it will grow no faster than the state economy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The insurance marketplaces are a centerpiece of President Obama’s health care law, but federal officials never expected to have to run them themselves.

headline.main: U.S. Officials Brace for Huge Task of Operating Health Exchanges
headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Brace for Huge Task Of Operating Health Exchanges

docs.abstract: Obama administration officials are preparing to set up and operate new health insurance markets in about half the states, where local officials appear unwilling or unable to do so; insurance marketplaces are a centerpiece of Pres Obama’s health care law, but federal officials never expected to have to run them themselves.
docs.snippet: The insurance marketplaces are a centerpiece of President Obama’s health care law, but federal officials never expected to have to run them themselves.
